snippet: Under pressure from the threat of nearly $1 trillion in forced spending reductions, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel says the days of automatic, equitable allotment to the Army, Air Force and Navy may be over.
abstract: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel says the days of automatic, equitable allotment to the different services in the armed forces may be over due to pressure from the threat of nearly $1 trillion in forced spending reductions; Pentagon has traditionally managed rivalries among services by giving each more or less equal shares of the base military budget.
lead_paragraph: Under pressure from the threat of nearly $1 trillion in forced spending reductions, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel says the days of automatic, equitable allotment to the Army, Air Force and Navy may be over.
